text: The Voice of Finland (season 6) is the sixth season of the Finnish reality singing competition based on The Voice format. The season premiered on Nelonen on January 6, 2017. The live final is scheduled on April 14, 2017. The coaches are singers Anna Puu, Olli Lindholm, Redrama and Michael Monroe. Heikki Paasonen hosts the program. ==Episodes== ===The Blind Auditions=== {| class="wikitable" style="height:2.6em" |- !Key |20px | | | |} ==== Episode 1: January 6, 2017 ==== {| class="wikitable" ===Battle rounds=== During battle rounds, coaches divide contestants to pairs and give them a song to perform. Coach then choose a winner to continue to the Knock Out phase. The losing contestant can still be stolen by another coach, as each coach can make two steals. Each coach is also joined by an adviser, with Michael Monroe being joined by singer Robin, Olli Lindholm by singer Ellinoora, Anna Puu by singer Pete Parkkonen, and Redrama by singer Diandra. ;Colour key {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 90%; white-space: nowrap;" |- | style="background:white; border:1px solid black;"| ' | Coach hit his/her "I WANT YOU" button |- | style="background:#fdfc8f; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist won the Battle and advanced to the Knockouts |- | style="background:#b0e0e6; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Battle but was stolen by another coach and advances to the Knockouts |- | style="background:pink; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Battle and was eliminated |} ====Episode 13: February 17, 2017==== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| 6 | rowspan="2"| Anna Puu | rowspan="2" style="background:#B0E0E6; text-align:center;" | Annika Syrjälä | style="background:pink; text-align:center;" | Kalle Rönkkö | rowspan="2"|"Kultaa hiuksissa" | rowspan="2" style="background:#b0e0e6;"| '''''' | rowspan="2" | — | rowspan="2" style="background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; vertical-align: middle; font-size: smaller; text-align: center; " | N/A | rowspan="2" | — |- | style="background:#fdfc8f; text-align:center;" | Emma Vaattovaara |} ===Knockout rounds=== The Knockout rounds were aired on 3, 9, 10, and 17 of March, 2017. Teams of 8 (Anna Puu and Redrama) and 9 (Michael Monroe and Olli Lindholm) were stripped down to 4 for the live shows. The knockout takes place in a form of four-chair challenge where after each performance the coach decides on giving a chair numbered from 1 (the best performance of the night) to 4 (the last place to qualify to the live finals) or eliminates the contestant immediately. When the chairs are full and the coach decides to give a numbered chair to another contestant, the contestant on the 4th chair is eliminated and other contestants change seats to adjust to the latest number. ;Colour key {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 90%; white-space: nowrap;" |- | style="background:#fdfc8f; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist was given a numbered chair and advanced to the live finals |- | style="background:pink; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist was eliminated |} ====Episode 17: March 3, 2017==== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:65%;" |- ! The live shows were aired on Friday at 8 PM from Logomo, Turku. ;Colour key {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 90%; white-space: nowrap;" |- | style="background:#fdfc8f; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist was saved by the Public's vote |- | style="background:lightblue; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist was saved by his/her coach |- | style="background:pink; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist was eliminated |} ====Live 1 March 24, 2017==== The first live show featured a group performance by the coaches, singing each other's popular songs: "Kickstart" (Redrama), "Minne tuulet vie" (Olli Lindholm), "Säännöt rakkaudelle" (Anna Puu), "Don't You Ever Leave Me" (Hanoi Rocks/Michael Monroe). {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:75%;" |- !
